data.Name: Lisa Blunt Rochester
data.staff_title: Executive Leadership & Systems Manager/Senior Research Fellow
data.staff_bio: Lisa Blunt Rochester is Senior Executive Leadership & Systems Manager/Senior Research Fellow at the ICI. As a practitioner, trainer and policy-maker, she has served in the cabinets of two Delaware governors as Deputy Secretary of Health and Social, Secretary of Labor and State Personnel Director. In those capacities she chaired the Governor's Council on Equal Employment Opportunity and the National Association of State Workforce Agencies' Labor Market Information sub-committee. In addition, she has worked with private sector employers, advocates and organized labor on issues such as, Welfare Reform and the creation of the statewide Workforce Investment Board. Ms. Rochester served as the CEO of the Metropolitan Wilmington Urban League, whose mission is to empower people of color to achieve economic self-reliance, parity and civil rights. In 2006, she moved to Shanghai, China, where she consulted with non-profit organizations, provided coaching services and co-authored, Thrive: 34 Women, 18 Countries, One Goal. At the ICI, Ms. Rochester focuses on public and non-profit leadership, systems change, and advising the dean of the School of Global Inclusion and Social Development.
data.staff_ed:
B.A., International Relations, Fairleigh Dickinson University
M.A., Urban Affairs and Public Policy, University of Delaware
data.staff_pubs:
Rochester, L.B. (Formerly Lisa Blunt-Bradley) (2001). Review of the Delaware State Police: Executive Order Number 19.
Rochester, L.B., Guzman, A. & Kuguru, R. (2010). Thrive: 34 Women, 18 Countries, One Goal.
